I've contributed a few of the patches I found useful to JUnit for use in 
my own functional testing.  This weekend I took those sources and 
polished them up into an actual JUnit extension, so you don't have to go 
in and patch your JUnit sources to access that functionality.  For those 
not doing functional testing, JFunc may still have a feature or two that 
you may find worthwhile.  The current features I have implemented:

* Multiple failures
* Easing the pains of Manual Suite Construction
	+ Concise, typesafe, suite construction using proxies
	+ Use one test object for a series of tests, rather than the one 
test instance per test
	+ Test methods can accept arguments
* Enhanced Test Runner
	+ Verbose assertions
	+ Pass arguments to tests on the CLI

Beyond just coding in features, I'd like to be able to put together some 
documentation on functional testing methodologies.

The code is licensed under the IBM Common Public License.

You can find the source and binaries on http://jfunc.sourceforge.net

-shane
subject: JFunc: JUnit Functional Testing Extension
